attributes.action: Ban production and sale of wet wipes containing polyester
attributes.background: Ban production and sale of wet wipes containing polyester as they pose a massive threat to marine life all over the world. Similar to plastic bags, they take at least 100 years to break down in landfill and when flushed down the toilet make their way into the food chain by being consumed by fish
attributes.additional_details: Each year about 7.6 billion pounds of wipes go to landfill. Many more of these are flushed down the toilet. Most wipes contain polyester and will take at least 100 years to degrade. When they are flushed down the toilet they do not break down like toilet paper and therefore can cause blockages in sewers. The wipes that do make it through the waste system often end up making their way into our rivers and oceans. Sea creatures accidentally consume them, putting plastic into our food chain.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332764

attributes.action: Ban the manufacturing, sale, and import of disposable vape pens in the UK
attributes.background: 168 million disposable vape pens are sold annually in the UK, with a significant number of discarded vapes not even making it to landfill; they are increasingly found in our streets, rivers, and seas, where they pose a threat to our ecosystem. As they gain popularity, the issue will get worse.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do vapes contain plastic, but also   metals in the battery and heating element, including 0.15g of lithium. Lithium can be toxic to wildlife, and there is evidence that both domestic and wild animals are attracted to chemicals found in vapes, which animals will seek out and chew with potentially lethal outcomes. Lithium is also rare, and is a vital component for batteries which are used for more useful devices, such as laptops and mobile phones. We should not be wasted it in vapes.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/628115

attributes.action: Make ALL water pollution into ANY body of natrual water a major crime.
attributes.background: All forms of pollution into any natural body of water to be completely OUTLAWED.
attributes.additional_details:
Agricultural and farming waste, industrial waste,  sewage and water company waste,  Livestock waste,  septic tank waste, oil waste.   

No types of waste or byproducts at all should be allowed into waterways, rivers and seas. 

No ifs, no buts, no maybes. 

All enterprises has to be responsible for there own waste. Waterways are a dumping ground.  

We are on the verge of ecological breakdown and unless this stops with we see a human and environmental health crisis of epic proportions.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about water pollution, but we're not sure exactly what you want the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already offences for:

- discharging poisonous, noxious or polluting matter or solid waste matter into inland freshwater, coastal waters and relevant territorial waters.

- discharging trade or sewage effluent into inland freshwater, coastal waters and relevant territorial waters.

It's unclear what additional actions you want to be made an offence, or if and how you want penalties for existing offences to be changed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Change laws to prevent sewage dumping into rivers.
attributes.background:
To  put a ban on sewage dumping. 
 To put in harsher punishments for organisations who may ignore laws which are already in place 
for the government to help clean rivers effected by the dumping of sewage or any substance which will effect the health of the river and its local ecosystem
attributes.additional_details: We want the government to act on this as many of these organisations will not respond to local voices. By adding a punishment we can hopefully reduce the number of accidents.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622551

attributes.action: Make it illegal to remove & keep any coarse fish from our rivers & lakes in UK
attributes.background: Thousands of course fish and being taken from rivers and lakes each year to be eaten at home or sold. This, along with the introduction of otters and the invasion of cormorants on inland waters is having a devastating effect on our coarse fish numbers.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it illegal to take fish for our rivers and lakes and it is unsustainable and stocks are being dramatically reduced. This will only be effective if the Environment Agency and/or Police actively address this problem.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578485

attributes.action: Introduce more severe penalties for cases of animal cruelty
attributes.background:
The current penalties for animal cruelty do not appear appropriate for the suffering inflicted on the animal.
We want the Parliament to introduce more severe penalties for cases of animal cruelty.
attributes.additional_details:
The story of a dog owner who tied the animal to a heavy rock and threw it in the river has shocked the nation, yet the owner was only fined £80, an amount equivalent to littering fines.
We believe this shows that cases of animal cruelty are not being taken seriously enough and should be punished more severely.

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/dog-rescue-river-drown-trent-nottinghamshire-court-b1815058.html

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the following petition which we currently have open:

Increase sentences for all animal cruelty offences
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565404

attributes.action: Guarantee Freeport employees today's workers' rights and NI provision
attributes.background: Freeports are presented as attractive, but in fact will erode workers' rights. No Union membership, longer hours, no NI benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
It is also problematic that included in the Zones are all our National Parks, and the sources of our major rivers. Are they about to be privatised - sold off? Is river water about to be diverted to the Freeports? And no-one yet knows what happens to the areas NOT in any Freeport Zone. Left to wither?
People need to be made aware of these dangers threatening us all. Let's see if they can wriggle out of telling the public the truth.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not aware of any proposals to remove existing legal rights from workers in Freeports. The latest Government guidance on freeports states

"There is no deregulatory agenda in Freeports, our Freeport model ensures that the UK’s high standards with respect to security, health and safety, workers’ rights, data protection, biosecurity, tax avoidance and the environment will not be compromised. Freeports – in the same way as every other business in the UK – will have to adhere to the UK’s high regulatory standards." 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/freeports

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: I want parliament to stop Sweden from culling wolves.
attributes.background: I want Government and Parliament to talk to the Swedish government and ask them to not cull any wolves. There are only 480 wolves in Sweden. Do you want innocent animals to die? It breaks a law set by the EU to protect endangered species. 27 countries agreed to this. Why would we do for cattle?
attributes.additional_details: In Yellowstone park wolves were eradicated but this left many problems for wildlife. Without wolves beavers couldn’t build dams, fish were unprotected, rivers were eroded. Elks overgrazed. But when biologists reintroduced wolves it had an amazing effect on the ecosystem. Mammals came back, songbirds sang again, beavers built dams. The world isn’t as picturesque without wolves. The ecosystem suffered without wolves. Imagine what’ll happen to Sweden? For a bunch of cattle. Is it really worth it?

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to cull the wolf population of Sweden are a matter for the Swedish government, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Please stop uk water companies from dumping sewage in our waterways and beaches.
attributes.background: The uk waters have ranked the worst in Europe.  Stop water companies dumping sewerage. With more staycations likely our children are playing in rivers, lakes and beaches please make sure they’re safe and clean.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ban Water Companies discharging raw sewage into water courses.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582336

attributes.action: Government to clarify whether Freeports are intended to become Charter Cities.
attributes.background: Clarification is needed as to how Freeports will differ from Charter Cities.
attributes.additional_details: Freeports are generally tax free ports. Many of ours are far inland, have zones which extend far beyond what is needed for a port, and include major river sources and national parks. Charter Cities can be owned by foreign entities and have their own legislation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  Petitions need to call for a change, such as the Government adopting a different policy. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop dangerous pollution from poultry farms along the Wye and its tributaries.
attributes.background: Intensive poultry units (IPUs) along the River Wye and its tributaries are turning it into a wildlife deathtrap and causing untold damage to one of Britain’s best loved rivers. Runoff from IPUs causes the spread of algal blooms that devastate the river’s ecosystem and turn the water a murky green.
attributes.additional_details: Take long-term strategic action to ensure that the UK poultry industry is environmentally sound, through effective delivery of the Environment Act, Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, the Well-Being of Future Generations Act and the Water Framework Directive. Conduct urgent research, regulate and monitor IPUs and enforce LPA planning conditions. Regulate the poultry industry and hold it to account for breach of environmental responsibility. Publish public reports on progress.

rejection.details:
Your petition appears to relate to activities in Wales, and planning and the environment are devolved matters, so the responsibility of the Welsh Government, Welsh local authorities and Natural Resources Wales, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition the Welsh Parliament here: https://petitions.senedd.wales/

attributes.action: Allow safe motorbike only access and free parking by the River Dee, Chester.
attributes.background: To allow safe motorbike only access and free parking by the River Dee, Chester. In between the Cafe at the Walls and The Groves.
attributes.additional_details: For years bikers have parked up safely along this stretch of road to enjoy a day out, which also provides enjoyment to pedestrians. Please can the government intervene with current council plans to restrict access and issue fines to motorcyclists.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the local authority and landowners

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Nationalise Water Companies for the future benefit of generations to come.
attributes.background: Take back all water supplies into public ownership.
attributes.additional_details: The water industry has taken £72 billion from households and businesses, yet all our rivers are unfit, and polluted. Our beaches are surrounded by sewage-contaminated water due to effluent being discharged. Water companies operate to create profit for shareholders, not to benefit the people. Standards are appalling. We, the people, need one national company owned by the nation to implement a standardised policy to clean our rivers and seas and to provide safe water for everyone.

rejection.details:
We currently have the following petition open which you might like to sign:

Renationalise water
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620881

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence and outlaw the dumping of raw sewage in rivers
attributes.background: The government must make it illegal for water companies to dump raw sewage in our rivers. It should be a crime to allow such destructive use of our water ways by these commercial enterprises.
attributes.additional_details: The government urgently needs to pass a law to stop immediately the dumping of raw sewage in our waterways. It’s destructive to nature and our beautiful countryside. It’s wrong on so many levels and a violation of government duties to be allowing this to go on.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Outdoor water fun for young children e.g. shallow water pool or fountains
attributes.background: Set out a specific place where families and children under a certain age can go to where there is safe water. There is currently no where for children to go to cool down other than rivers or big swimming pools etc. Whether it is a very shallow pool or fountains where water can be recycled.
attributes.additional_details: The local area does not currently have somewhere for families and children to go to. Now lockdown is over and more summer days are coming. Children and families would appreciate having somewhere to go. Around the water area a few bins can be added so there is no litter and maybe even it can be fenced so there is added security. There is not much a single person to do so this is why I decided to make a petition for the council to see if they can help not just me but other families

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local pools and other water-based play areas, are a matter for individual local authorities and leisure facilities, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban face masks
attributes.background: Ban the use of face masks due them being improperly worn & irresponsibly disposed of.
attributes.additional_details: There is an ever increasing amount of face masks being improperly worn & irresponsibly disposed of on the floor which make their way into rivers & our seas polluting them & the wildlife there. It is not only an unsightly mess but a health hazard & potential environmental catastrophe waiting to happen. They are causing more harm than good & we have a moral duty not just to fellow human beings but other living inhabitants of this planet which we share.  Urgent action is needed. #BanTheMask

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549832

If you want the Government to ban all face masks, you could start a new petition requesting this.

attributes.action: Urgently re-start dredging our rivers.
attributes.background: Now we have left the EU re-start dredging our rivers to increase their capacity and reduce flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Because lack of dredging is a major cause of river flooding.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about flood management, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Dredging and the removal of silt and sand from main rivers is regulated under the Environmental Permitting Regulations 2010, but decisions about dredging of individual rivers is a matter for individual local authorities and the Environment Agency, not the Government or House of Commons.

EU laws did affect decisions about dredging, but the practice was not banned while the UK was a member of the EU. You can read more about this here: https://fullfact.org/online/EU-dredging-floods/

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban development on flood plains, and review guidance on dredding of rivers, if that is something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Ban fipronil and imidacloprid from pet flea products as they kill river insects
attributes.background: One flea treatment contains enough pesticide to kill 60 million bees! The washing of pets flushes chemicals into rivers, while dogs swimming is another pathway for contamination. Rivers are being polluted. The government is requested to ban the use of these products in all pet flea treatments.
attributes.additional_details: Almost 4,000 samples recently gathered by the Environment Agency in 20 English rivers showed Fipronil was detected in 99% of samples and a highly toxic breakdown product called fipronil sulfone was found in 97%. The average concentrations were 5 and 38 times higher than their chronic toxicity limits, respectively. Imidacloprid was found in 66% of the samples and was above toxicity limits in seven of the 20 rivers.  Many pets are treated every month, whether needed or not.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of disposable BBQ's.
attributes.background: I would like to have these items removed from sale and have using them in a public place made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's are responsible for many fires in the UK, in our local and national parks and areas of natural beauty. They are not actually very good at cooking and often used by people in an unsafe manner. They leave burns dotted about our green spaces that do not recover well as the soil is sterilised by the heat. They are often discarded thoughtlessly, while still alight, and create a significant hazard to wildlife and livestock. They also end up polluting rivers, lakes, fields and woods.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Compulsory Domestic Rainwater Collection for all New build homes
attributes.background:
Joined Up thinking by Planning Authorities

Produce guidance or statute to ensure that Planning Authorities require all new homes built in the UK to require inclusion of an appropriately sized rainwater collection system and associated Grey water supply to WC's and other non-potable connections.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of new houses increase demand for treated water and sewerage.

Climate Change means bigger, more frequent storms and more FLOODING.

If every new home included a rainwater collection system then:

1. Reduced need to spend £Billions to enlarge sewers
2. Prevent inundation of Water Treatment Works, reducing the number of raw sewerage discharges to rivers and sea. [HoL: Sewage pollution in England’s waters, 30 June, 2022]
4.  Reduce treated water demand
5. Reduce the risk of flooding

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621729

attributes.action: Change the regulation of water companies to stop "dry spills" immediately
attributes.background: Change the regulation of water companies, to make it a legal requirment to stop dry spills from sewage outflows immediately. To mitigate wet weather outflows by making water companies satutory consultees on planning applications
attributes.additional_details: Wet weather outflows of sewage occur when surface water overwhelms the sewer system, dry spills are sewage outflows that occur when there has not been any rainfall. They allow sewage to flow into rivers and seas.  To maintain safe bathing waters, this needs to stop immediately. In making water companies statutory consultees on planning applicatons, measures to mitigate excess surface water and lack of adequate drainage can be addressed, reducing wet weather outflows.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you're concerned about sewage outflows, but we're not sure whether you want action to prevent all outflows, or against dry spills which are already likely to be illegal. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: We request a change in the legislation relating to dredged material.
attributes.background: Bring into UK law a clear framework for the regulation and control of dredging. To set out safe systems and controls to cover all dredging activities. The decontamination and safe disposal on land of all dredged materials. Substantial fines to be imposed for breaches of the regulations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are no regulations stopping dredged sediment being dumped into the sea. We have over 100 years of industrial pollution that has settled in the deep sediment of many of our industrial rivers. 
The toxic sediment is currently allowed to be dumped out to sea, risking an environmental catastrophe which effects a wide range of sea life and a health risk to human life.
At this time of a climate emergency we can take no chances with the health of our oceans.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the disposal of dredged material at sea. However the disposal of such material at sea is already regulated by the Marine Management Organisation, which has the power to license such disposals and impose fines for breaches of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009. You can read this Act here: https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2009/23/contents.

It's therefore not clear how the regulation you want would be different from what is already in place.  

You could have a petition calling for these regulations to be changed in some specific way, so long as it was clear from the petition what these changes were.

attributes.action: Allow communities to use beavers for flood management and increase biodiversity
attributes.background: The River Otter Beaver trial in Devon has proven beyond doubt the benefits of reintroducing beavers. Not only do they help with flood prevention, beavers increase biodiversity by creating new habitats for plants and animals, offer tourism opportunities, store carbon and clean water, at very low cost
attributes.additional_details: I am a parish councillor at Braunton, North Devon and I would like to reintroduce beavers to the River Caen catchment to help reduce flooding, increase biodiversity, create tourist and academic opportunities, store carbon, and clean river water to encourage migratory fish. Current legislation will not allow this to happen. I think beavers represent a huge opportunity to use the greatest water engineers on the planet to help solve flooding, and biodiversity loss, caused by climate change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about current restrictions on the release of beavers, but we're not sure if you want the Government to remove all legal restrictions on the release of beavers, or to allow local authorities to release beavers for the purpose of flood management without needing to obtain a licence, or something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Establish mandatory buffer zones of a minimum of 10 metres,next to watercourses.
attributes.background: Our rivers and streams are part of our National Infrastructure. River and stream margins protect our rivers and streams, store water, clean water, provide important habitat for our wildlife and store carbon. Many of our margins are lost through agriculture and development.
attributes.additional_details:
Development on floodplains is a prime cause of catastrophic flooding.
Soil erosion from fields cost the taxpayer £150million per year (Cranfield University 2009) Margins stop the soil leaving the fields.
The mandatory buffer zones will reduce the run-off into rivers of pesticides and fertilisers used in agriculture.
 Wilder river and stream corridors created through mandatory buffer zones  will reduce flooding, reduce pollution, capture carbon, help biodiversity, help business and help people

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about development near watercourses, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition calls for "buffer zones", but doesn't say what these should involve.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Adapt Water Protection Laws to what they were Pre-Brexit
attributes.background: In recent years, after Brexit, Water Pollution has massively increased within river systems within England, as they have repealed most of the Water Protection laws that were EU laws. In order to have a government that cares for the people, we need our water systems to be safe from pollutants.
attributes.additional_details: Water Pollution has been scientifically proven to have adverse and damaging effects on the natural local biodiversity of environments across river basins and a dramatic effect on human health for those residing in river basins which are affected by Water Pollution. With the government's help in reinstating European Union water protection laws, we can ensure that the British Public has access to clean and safe rivers without the risk of chemical, thermal and environmentally damaging pollution

rejection.details:
It is not the case that most EU laws relating to water have been repealed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Keep retained EU environmental laws until equal or stronger UK laws introduced: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623839

attributes.action: The UK is in crisis and we, the public, are calling for a general election.
attributes.background: We want a GE so that we, the public, can make a democratic decision as to whom we think will be the most democratic, honest and work hardest to remedy the problems we currently face such as: the cost of living crisis, the NHS including all aspects, care sector, water companies etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Because over the last 12 years we have suffered austerity and now a severe cost of living crisis and this Government is not doing anywhere near enough to remedy it. We need urgent action and we need a Government that will deliver what we all need. 

The energy cap needs to be fixed, water companies need to be made to stop putting raw sewage into our rivers, the NHS and Police and Social Care are struggling to get enough staff to make people safe. The list is too long for this petition.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

attributes.action: Nationalise the water companies now.
attributes.background: Make water a publicly owned utility again. Stop raw sewage being dumped in our rivers and seas immediately. Forbid the water companies from selling any more reservoirs. Fine the water companies now and stop them paying any dividends or bonuses while they are being nationalised.
attributes.additional_details: During the decades that the water companies have been private they have let billions of tons of drinking water be wasted through leaks which they have not fixed. They have sold off reservoirs instead of building new ones. They are killing our rivers and harming our seas by dumping raw sewage into them. No country outside the UK has a fully privatised water sector; it has been a disaster and needs to be back under public, not private, control.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620881

attributes.action: Halt new housing development until new sewage processing infrastructure is built
attributes.background: Halt approval for new housing development in Oxfordshire until new sewage processing infrastructure is built that can deal with future demand as well as future flooding events WITHOUT polluting our rivers with raw sewage.
attributes.additional_details: Wildlife and ecosystems are dying due to lack of government funding in sewage processing infrastructure. This has led to a situation where sewage plants cannot deal with current demand. Meanwhile new housing projects proliferate wherever you look which will only add to the problem. We need to address the root cause and solve it. Plan and build new sewage processing infrastructure that will cope with future demands plus future flooding events without releasing raw sewage into our rivers.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to applications for planning permission are a matter for the relevant local authority - in this case, Oxfordshire County Council - not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could have a petition calling for the Government to provide local authorities with funding to improve sewage processing infrastructure, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601730

attributes.action: Finance completion of the Metropolitan Line Extension to Watford Junction.
attributes.background: To provide funds for, and instruct TfL and Network Rail to expedite, construction of the Metropolitan Line Extension over the nearby closed Croxley Green route to Watford High Street and Watford Junction.
attributes.additional_details:
This connection will provide a direct link to the mainline railway network for residents along the Metropolitan Line, and the Chiltern Railways route from Marylebone to Aylesbury.  Currently any passengers needing access to the West Coast Main Line must travel into London and use Euston or Euston Square Underground stations.  This is a long and unnecessary journey.

Moreover, the Croxley Link, AKA the Metropolitan Line Extension will integrate, and provide a central interchange for, all railway services in the Three Rivers area.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of Transport for London, the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Make Seaweed Packaging mandatory as a direct replacement for plastic.
attributes.background: To make it law that companies have to use seaweed based packaging as a direct replacement for plastic in their business where possible This will co-ordinate a countrywide response and lead the global conversation that we need to act now on this.Manufacturers have an environmental responsibility too.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic packaging used in a variety of consumer goods is causing a worldwide choking of our oceans and rivers. If we can stop this at source, at the manufacturing stage before the consumer buys the product, we will drastically reduce the impact on our environment, while balancing the needs of our economy. Seaweed degrades naturally, is as strong a plastic and where it is possible to replace plastic we all need to do it. Time is running out for us to change our ways. You can unify these efforts

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament is directly responsible for. Decisions about what material to use to replace plastic is a matter for individual companies, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban all single-use plastic:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586547

Ban the use of virgin plastics in all packaging sold in the UK before 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586539

Ban the use of plastic food packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595495

attributes.action: Amend environment bill to stop sewage being pumped into rivers and seas
attributes.background: Make an amendment to the environment bill to regulate the level of treatment required of sewage and prevent it simply being pumped into our rivers and seas. If this requires support from the government for water companies put this in place.
attributes.additional_details: Britains rivers and seas and marine life are being threatened by the introduction of untreated sewage. This needs to be regulated and water companies required to treat and dispose of sewage in a responsible way. Sewage is entering the food chain!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Bring the CEO's of all UK water companies causing pollution to rivers to court.
attributes.background: The UK Government Amend all present legislation to bring the Directors and CEO's of all UK water companies to account  personally in the courts by means of personal summons when their company causes any pollution and or causes environmental harm to rivers and waterways of England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
Presently, Water Utilities are continually polluting rivers and waterways with daily impunity whilst the Regulators watch without action taken.
Making the CEO's and the Boards of Directors personally responsible along with the operational managers to account in the courts will ensure a greater application of due diligence thus imposing stronger measures to avoid claimed accidents when these are deliberate and or events that are clearly avoidable at any time by reducing incompetence.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about criminal action being brought in respect of water pollution, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It is already possible for senior staff of corporate bodies to be prosecuted for environmental offences, where they have committed a relevant offence. You can read the Environment Agency's enforcement and sanctions policy here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/environment-agency-enforcement-and-sanctions-policy/environment-agency-enforcement-and-sanctions-policy

Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are an operational matter for the Environment Agency.

attributes.action: Ban all disposable single use face masks (apart from medical use)

https://www.tradewaste.co.uk/53-million-disposable-face-masks-sent-to-landfill-every-single-day/

The CoronaVirus (Covid19) is in fact far less lethal the Winter Flu itself. Only around 10 per cent of people who catch the CoronaVirus (Covid19) usually actually die from it as well. In the mean time people's houses are flooding and the cars are getting ruined also because of Global Warming (The Polar Ice Cap melting) causing the sea and river levels to rise high.

attributes.action: Put chlorine in Rivers around the UK
attributes.background: I want the government to spend some money met on putting chlorine into rivers around the UK
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to do this because In summer a lot of people go swimming in dirty rivers and I believe the government should look into this so people can enjoy there summer in a safe way

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand that you would like to ensure that river water is clean and safe for people to swim in, but we're not sure how the addition of chlorine to a body of moving water would ensure a clean and safe swimming area.

You can find out more about safe open water swimming here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/swim-healthy-leaflet/swim-healthy

attributes.action: Rename the River Thames as River Gulu just as the British renamed Lake Victoria
attributes.background:
The British are responsible for erasing alot of our history and renaming most of our African magnificent landmarks in the name of whichever Sovereign was on the throne.

We therefore feel that is it prudent that we hereby petition that from this day forth the River Thames be known as River Gulu
attributes.additional_details:
The British Government and its people continue to benefit from the generational wealth derived from Africa during and after the savagery of the Colonial era. The British Government maintains the cultural and social capital and prestige afforded those who have forcefully imposed uncouth names on our African landmarks for decades.

We believe that in the spirit of fairness and equity renumeration that the Government hereby acknowledge our claim to rename one of your landmarks as we see fit.

rejection.details: Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. The Government is not responsible for the name of the River Thames. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

attributes.action: Clean up UK Oceans and Rivers so we're free to swim and protect ecodiversity
attributes.background: As water users we want to be able to get in the water as much as possible. But not only can we end up covered in raw sewage when it has been discharged, we're at risk of gastroenteritis, ear, nose and throat infections, skin infections, and even hepatitis and e-coli.
attributes.additional_details:
Water quality is also deadly for river and ocean wildlife, reducing biodiversity and causing huge damage to these delicate ecosystems. 

In 2020 alone, there were over 400,000 discharges of untreated sewage into UK rivers and 2,941 discharges into UK coastal bathing waters. 

We won't stand for this any longer.
#EndSewagePollution

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about cleanliness of oceans and waters, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Give the Environment Agency the funds and freedom to protect English rivers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586378

Make it illegal for water companies to dump sewage into rivers and seas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: Ban the insecticide fipronil from all UK pet flea & tick products
attributes.background: The Government needs to ban the insecticide fipronil from all pet flea and tick products in the UK to protect the fish in our rivers. The UK's wildlife is already vulnerable and this toxic chemical is damaging our aquatic life, despite only being found in flea products.
attributes.additional_details: Fipronil is an insecticide that was banned by the EU for agricultural purposes in 2017. It is still a common ingredient in pet flea treatments, but is highly toxic to fish. Fipronil enters our waterways through household drains from washing our pets, their bedding and our hands. It was found in 99% of rivers studied and breaks down into a product 3 to 6 times more toxic. One dog can kill an entire pond of fish when treated with fipronil. It needs to be removed from our environment and homes.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign this petition which we currently have open:

Ban the sale and use of Fipronil and Imidacloprid in flea treatments for pets
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905

attributes.action: Restart dredging the rivers to stop the flooding. Stop building on flood plains.
attributes.background: Now that we have left the EU we should start dredging the rivers again to stop the flooding. Stop building on flood plains will also help with the natural order of nature.
attributes.additional_details: We never had no where near as much flooding as we do now when the rivers were dredged on a regular basis. The sludge could be used on the fields as natural fertiliser the rivers would flow better, natural drainage all round. So much better for the environment and will save billions in insurance claims and no more devastated home owners losing everything year on year in flood areas.

rejection.details:
Dredging and the removal of silt and sand from main rivers is regulated under the Environmental Permitting Regulations 2010, but decisions about dredging of individual rivers is a matter for individual local authorities and the Environment Agency, not the Government or House of Commons.

EU laws did affect decisions about dredging, but the practice was not banned while the UK was a member of the EU. You can read more about this here: https://fullfact.org/online/EU-dredging-floods/

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban development on flood plains, and review guidance on dredding of rivers, if that is something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Ensure flood protection for villages downstream of the Jubilee River
attributes.background: Ensure RBWM Council meet their obligations to keep residents safe from flooding. To not devalue homes, land & other property, and ultimately endanger lives & livelihoods of everyone who lives there by not contributing to their section of the River Thames Scheme or providing other adequate defenses
attributes.additional_details:
2014 - villages of Wraysbury, Horton, Datchet & Old Windsor suffered the worst floods since 1947 effecting 1000's properties. At that time RBWM committed to contributing their share of the section of the proposed River Thames Scheme that would protect its residents downstream of the Jubilee River. 

In September 2020, RBWM confirmed that they would no longer be contributing to the scheme with no further information on how to keep residents safe from flooding in future

attributes.action: Grant the Environment Agency powers to monitor and penalise water companies.
attributes.background: Water companies and landowners should be monitored by the Environment Agency and if they are found to be polluting rivers they should be penalised. There should be investment in the sewage system so that it operates more efficiently in extreme weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 the government acknowledged that only 14% of English rivers are in good ecological condition.  Despite this they have not brought in measures to monitor how water companies and landowners are misusing our rivers and ,through the Environment Agency,  are not penalizing companies and landowners who routinely pollute our waterways. Last year 1.5m hours of raw sewage was pumped into English rivers posing a serious risk to human health as well as damaging the environment.
